Grade 1:.Test cases: Does not pass any test case.

Grade 1:.Understanding of the problem: It shows not understanding of the problem.

Grade 1:.Strategy used: Could be a strategy to solve an other problem.

Grade 2:.Level before: Does not contain ay item belonging to the level 1.

Grade 2:.Data structures: Has the right data estructures but they are not well implemented, bad used or they are not coherent.

Grade 2:.Test cases: Does not pass any test case or pases one or  two maximum.

Grade 2:.Understanding of the problem: It shows a very basic or alomost null understanding of the problem to be solved.

Grade 2:.Strategy used:
The solution does not use a right approach to solve the problem. Could have been using brute force or an other approache that does not work.
Ther is not a clear purpose in the source code and in the strategy (i.e difficult to follow).

Grade 3:.Level before: Does not contain any item from the level 2.

Grade 3:.Data structures: The right structures need to solve the problem exist and are well implemented.

Grade 3:.Understanding of the problem: Shows a partial understanding of how to solve the problem.

Grade 3:.Strategy used: The strategy used to solve the problem is close to the one proposed.

Grade 4:.Data structures: Has problems with the definition of the data types, conditionals or number of cycles.

Grade 4:.Understanding of the problem:
Shows a complete understanding of how to solve the problem
Does not identify small details like border cases.

Grade 4:.Strategy used: The strategy used to solve the problem is clear, easy to follow and according to the expected..

Grade 5:.Data structures: Does not have any prolbme with data type, conditionals, cycles, etc.

Grade 5:.Understanding of the problem: Shows a full understanding of how to solve the problem.

Grade 5:.Strategy used: The strategy used to solve the problem is clear, easy to read and according to the expected.
